page.title: 06INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: {Mr. C. Gibbard-Village Lengthman.} We interviewed Mr Gibbard who has been employed as the Lengthman since the job was created in 1983. He told us that the dirtiest place in M.C. is behind the chip shop. His busiest day is on a Monday after the weekend. In 1984 M.C. won the Northamptonshire Tidiest Village Competition (large village section). {Mr L. Jerrams-Local Historian.} Mr Jerrams has lived in M.C. all his life. His house,"Celanlea", is a very old cottage which is a listed building. In 1984 Mr Jerrams had his first book published,"A Brief History Of Middleton Cheney, Northamptonshire With Childhood Memories". Mr Jerrams has recorded in his book how the Village has changed during his lifetime and what buildings have been destroyed; for example 23 houses in Queen Street alone.
